meanings.def: a plant grown in warm countries for the soft white hairs around its seeds that are used to make cloth and thread
examples: From the age of six she worked in the fields, picking cotton.

meanings.def: the cloth made from the cotton plant
examples: The sheets are 100 per cent pure cotton.
shivering in her thin cotton nightdress

meanings.def: thread that is used for sewing
a soft mass of white material that is used for cleaning the skin or a wound
examples: Use a cotton ball to apply the lotion.

meanings.def: (1663-1728) an American Puritan minister in Boston. He wrote more than 400 works on religion, history, science and other subjects. His writings led to an increased fear of witches (= women thought to have evil magic powers) and helped to cause the Salem witch trials, although Mather himself was opposed to them. He also helped to establish Yale University and was the first person born in America to be elected to the Royal Society of London.
